data.text:
Teacher, Jul 1985 - Dec 1988 SMA (Senior High School) YWKA, Bandung (West Java)

From July 1985 to December 1988, I was employed as a Teacher at SMA YWKA in Bandung, West Java. SMA YWKA Bandung is a high school in Bandung, West Java, Indonesia, founded in 1983 and owned by KAI's women's foundation. The school aims to cultivate compassionate leaders and offers majors in science, social studies, and language. It has a team of professional teachers and modern facilities to support students' learning and extracurricular activities. The school has a partnership with PT KAI, a state-owned railway company, providing opportunities for its students and teachers.

For a period of almost three and a half years, I held the position of a mathematics and physics teacher. My role mainly involved providing high-quality education in these subjects and creating a conducive learning environment. I aimed to impart knowledge and promote critical thinking and problem-solving skills among my students.

To achieve my teaching objectives, I developed customized lesson plans and teaching resources tailored to meet the unique learning styles and abilities of each student. I encouraged classroom participation and fostered inclusivity, allowing students to comfortably explore complex topics and ask questions. Moreover, I provided personalized support to struggling students outside regular class hours, using a one-on-one approach to tailor my teaching methods to meet individual needs.

After completing my Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering in 1988, I transitioned to a career in engineering. My experience as a teacher enriched my interest in guiding others and connecting with people. Teaching mathematics and physics equipped me with analytical thinking skills that I can utilize in my future endeavors.

Piping-Pipeline Engineer, Dec 1988 — Jun 1990 PT. Ceria Utama Abadi (CUA)

From December 1988 to June 1990, I worked as a Piping-Pipeline Engineer at PT. Ceria Utama Abadi (CUA). This job opportunity helped me to transition from teaching to engineering.

PT. Ceria Utama Abadi is an Indonesian company that offers engineering, construction, and personnel services to various industries, with a focus on oil, gas, energy, and power. The company was founded in 1982 in Balikpapan and aims to provide innovative and high-quality solutions to its clients.

For a duration of one year and seven months, I was involved in multiple projects with different clients of the company. These projects involved gas pipeline construction for PGN (Perusahaan Gas Negara), metering systems upgrade for Pertamina, air conditioning system upgrade for VICO, and carbon black facilities construction for Carbon Black Indonesia (currently known as Cabot Indonesia).

In my previous role, I had several responsibilities such as preparing bid proposals and cost estimates for clients and companies, project planning, collecting project requirements and specifications, and ensuring that projects were aligned with client needs and met industry standards. Additionally, I was tasked with controlling project schedules and overseeing mechanical drafting teams that supported project development. In fulfilling my responsibilities, I used AutoCAD and applied international standards for process piping and pipelines.

To succeed in my previous role, I worked closely with diverse teams to prepare detailed bid proposals and cost estimates. I analyzed project requirements, developed comprehensive plans, and ensured that projects were executed efficiently and effectively. As a supervisor of mechanical drafting teams, I provided guidance and direction, ensuring that all project drawings and documentation met the required standards and specifications. I also applied international standards for process piping and pipelines to guarantee the highest safety and quality of our projects.

Mechanical Engineer, Jul 1990 — Jun 1991 PT. Nippon Steel Construction Indonesia (NISCONI)

During the period of July 1990 to June 1991, I worked as a Mechanical Engineer at PT. Nippon Steel Construction Indonesia (NISCONI). NISCONI is a subsidiary of Nippon Steel Engineering Co., Ltd., a global company that provides engineering, construction, and personnel services to various industries. Established in 1972, NISCONI aims to be a leading company in engineering and construction in Indonesia and Southeast Asia. The company specializes in the engineering, procurement, construction, transportation, and installation of onshore and offshore oil and gas facilities. NISCONI has completed numerous projects for major clients, including Pertamina, Chevron, ExxonMobil, Arco, and Total.

For a duration of one year, I was involved in different projects, including BJ, EJ, and BK, which were ARCO's offshore production platforms on the Java Sea. As a mechanical engineer, my responsibilities encompassed designing mechanical equipment and piping systems for the projects that I was assigned to. Additionally, I played a critical role in defining project requirements and specifications to ensure that they complied with the client's needs and industry norms. I was also responsible for controlling project schedules, costs, and quality.

To execute my responsibilities, I worked closely with interdisciplinary teams, applying my mechanical engineering expertise and adhering to international standards for process piping and pressure vessels to ensure the safety and integrity of the systems. I also supervised the field fabrication and installation processes, ensuring all work was completed following the project plans and quality standards.

My role necessitated close coordination with stakeholders, including contractors and clients, to ensure the successful execution of each project.

Construction Engineer, Jul 1991 — Jun 1997 JOB Pertamina - Husky (Limau) Ltd (PHL)

From July 1991 to June 1997, the role I held was that of a Construction Engineer at JOB Pertamina - Husky (Limau) Ltd (PHL). In 1989, PT Pertamina (Persero), the national oil and gas company of Indonesia, and Husky Energy Inc., a Canadian integrated energy company, formed a joint operating body (JOB) called Pertamina and Husky Energy (Limau) Ltd. This partnership was established to explore and extract oil and gas from the Limau Block situated onshore in Prabumulih, South Sumatra, Indonesia.

The construction projects I worked on for six years included developing water flooding facilities, replacing oil and gas pipelines, and upgrading block stations. As a Construction Engineer, my role was critical to project success and multifaceted. I supervised construction projects related to oil and gas infrastructure and facilities. This involved overseeing project schedules, costs, and quality to ensure timely and cost-effective completion of the projects. To ensure adherence to national and international standards, I collaborated closely with cross-functional teams, contractors, and project stakeholders to manage and supervise the construction projects. Additionally, I applied PERTAMINA's Joint Operating Body (JOB) system in budgeting and project proposals, ensuring compliance with relevant laws and rules, and best practices recognized in the industry. The planning and execution required meticulous attention to detail and effective communication with both internal and external stakeholders.

Sr. Facilities Engineer, Jul 1997 — Dec 2004 JOB Pertamina - Seaunion Energy (Limau) Ltd (PSEL)

From July 1997 to December 2004, I held the role of Senior Facilities Engineer at JOB Pertamina - Seaunion Energy (Limau) Ltd (PSEL).

JOB Pertamina and Seaunion Energy (Limau) Ltd is a joint operating body (JOB) between PT Pertamina (Persero), the national oil and gas company of Indonesia, and Seaunion (Limau) Ltd, a subsidiary of Seaunion Energy Inc., a Hongkong integrated energy company. The JOB was established in 1997 to develop and produce oil and gas from the Limau Block, located onshore in Prabumulih, South Sumatra, Indonesia.

For seven and half years, I managed various engineering and construction projects for oil and gas facilities and infrastructure.

As a Senior Facilities Engineer, my responsibilities were diverse and vital to project success. I oversaw the end-to-end engineering, construction, and maintenance process, ensuring seamless integration of these critical phases.

To excel, I worked closely with interdisciplinary teams, contractors, and project stakeholders to manage and lead engineering and construction projects. I applied my expertise to meet national and international standards in the design phase, ensuring that tasks were developed with the highest safety, efficiency, and quality.

Additionally, I applied Indonesia's Joint Operating Body (JOB) system in financial budgeting and project proposals. This involved meticulous financial planning and budgeting, ensuring compliance with relevant rules, laws, and recognized best practices in the industry. My role required effective coordination with internal and external stakeholders to achieve successful project outcomes.

Construction Superintendent, Jan 2005 — Dec 2005 PT. Cahaya Batu Raja Block (CBRB)

From January 2005 to December 2005, I held the position of Construction Superintendent at PT. Cahaya Batu Raja Block (CBRB).

PT. Cahaya Batu Raja Block is a subsidiary of Seaunion Energy Inc., a Hongkong integrated energy company operating Batu Raja Block, located in Batu Raja, South Sumatra, on the Production Sharing Contact (PSC) scheme.

For one year, I oversaw various general construction projects related to infrastructure.

As a Construction Superintendent, my role was multifaceted and pivotal to the success of construction projects. I was responsible for managing all aspects of the projects, including transportation, mobilization, demobilization, and local logistics.

To excel in my role, I closely managed construction projects from start to finish, ensuring that they met project requirements and specifications. I supervised and coordinated the transportation, mobilization, and demobilization of equipment and materials, allowing for the efficient execution of the projects.

Additionally, I applied my project management skills to control project schedules, costs, and quality. I also diligently ensured that all project activities complied with relevant laws and rules and recognized best practices in the construction industry. Effective communication with internal and external stakeholders was essential to completing projects.

Facilities Engineering Lead, Jan 2006 — Dec 2012 Kalrez Petroleum (Seram) Ltd.

From January 2006 to December 2012, I held the role of Facilities Engineering Lead at Kalrez Petroleum (Seram) Ltd.

PT. Kalrez Petroleum (Seram) Ltd. is a subsidiary of Seaunion Energy Inc., a Hong Kong integrated energy company operating Bula Block, located in Seram Islan, Maluku, Indonesia, on the Production Sharing Contact (PSC) scheme.

For seven years, I was responsible for overseeing a wide range of engineering and construction projects and programs for oil and gas facilities, including surface facilities, oil storages, gathering stations, block stations, oil-gas-water separators, buildings, jetties, flow lines, pipelines, and power generators.

As a Facilities Engineering Lead, my role was pivotal and multifaceted. I managed and led projects and programs related to oil and gas facilities. This included overseeing the design, construction, and maintenance phases, ensuring that all aspects were integrated for facility availability, maintainability, and reliability.

To excel, I collaborated closely with interdisciplinary teams, contractors, and project stakeholders to manage and lead various engineering and construction projects. My expertise was essential in adhering to national and international project design standards, ensuring that the projects were developed with the highest standards of safety, efficiency, and quality.

I also played a critical role in controlling project schedules, costs, risks, and quality to ensure successful project delivery. Applying Indonesia's Production Sharing Contract (PSC) system in budgeting and cost estimating required meticulous financial planning, compliance with relevant laws and rules, and the recognition of best practices in the industry. Effective communication with internal and external stakeholders was crucial to project success. r.

Operations Manager, Jan 2013 — Oct 2015 Kalrez Petroleum (Seram) Ltd.

From January 2013 to October 2015, I worked as an Operations Manager at Kalrez Petroleum (Seram) Ltd. Kalrez Petroleum (Seram) Ltd. is a subsidiary of Seaunion Energy Inc., a Hong Kong-based integrated energy company. The company operates Bula Block located in Seram Island, Maluku, Indonesia, under the Production Sharing Contact (PSC) scheme.

The following text describes my role as an Operations Manager in the oil and gas industry. My responsibilities included managing various aspects of oil and gas operations such as production operations, facilities maintenance, and well services. I had to interface with various departments such as supply chain, HR, and financial management to ensure seamless and efficient operations. I closely managed oil and gas operations, addressing various challenges and optimizing production with minimal resources. I collaborated with interdisciplinary teams and departments to ensure that all functions, from production to maintenance, were integrated for efficient and reliable performance.

I also played a critical role in applying Indonesia's Production Sharing Contract (PSC) scheme and the SKKMIGAS system in procurement. This required meticulous planning and compliance with relevant laws, rules, and recognized best practices in the industry. Effective communication and coordination with internal and external stakeholders were essential for successfully operating oil and gas activities.

After retiring from Kalrez in September 2015, I started building my own company.

President Director, Jan 2016 — Present PT. Telaga Cipta Indonesia

From January 2016, I have held the position of President Director at PT. Telaga Cipta Indonesia. PT. Telaga Cipta Indonesia is a privately owned company that specializes in marketing and exporting Indonesian products such as agro products, sea products, herbs and spices, furniture, and handicrafts globally. The company was established in January 2016.

Since January 2016, I have been responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of the company, as well as guiding its overall strategy and shaping its future direction. As President Director, my responsibilities include overseeing all aspects of the company's operations, identifying and pursuing new business opportunities, managing the organization's finances, and providing expert consulting services to clients.

To effectively fulfill my role as President Director, I actively engage with the company's leadership and employees to provide clear direction and effective leadership. This involves setting strategic priorities, monitoring progress, and making informed decisions that drive the company's success. As part of my duties, I conduct market research and analysis to identify emerging opportunities and make informed decisions about where to allocate resources and efforts.

In managing the company's finances, I use my financial acumen to ensure responsible management of the company's assets and resources. This includes budgeting, financial forecasting, and resource allocation. Additionally, I leverage my expertise in the field to provide consulting services to clients. I draw upon my knowledge and experience to offer tailored solutions and recommendations that address their unique challenges and objectives.

Professional Course Instructor, Jan 2016 – present. Adovasz Indonesia, Pythagoras Training & Consulting, IPDC Training Institute, and Medco Project Management Academy (MPMA)

Since January 2016, I have worked as a Professional Course Instructor for Adovasz Indonesia, Pythagoras Training & Consulting, IPDC Training Institute, and Medco Project Management Academy. These companies provide professional training services and consultancy for various industries and disciplines.

From January 2016 to present, I have worked in a role where I share knowledge and expertise in project management, project governance, leadership, and Buzan mind-mapping.

My responsibilities include designing and delivering high-impact project management and leadership courses. I also teach courses in Buzan mind mapping, a technique for enhancing creativity, organization, and problem-solving. I have developed comprehensive course materials incorporating the latest industry best practices. A student-centric approach is employed, fostering an interactive learning environment. In project management and leadership courses, real-world insights and examples are provided. The latest tools and techniques are used to prepare students to meet the challenges of the business world. In Buzan Mind Mapping courses, students learn how to harness the power of visual thinking and creative problem-solving. Mind-mapping skills are developed to enhance the ability to organize ideas and information effectively.

Project Coordinator, Feb 2016 — Mar 2019 PT. Medco E&P Malaka (MEPM)

From February 2016 to March 2019, I was a Project Coordinator at PT. Medco E&P Malaka.

PT. Medco E&P Malaka, a subsidiary of Medco Energi Internasional, Tbk., operates Block A Gas Field in Aceh, Indonesia. It developed a gas production field and facilities to provide gas for PLN. The facilities include a central processing plant, pipeline and wells site facilities, off-site facilities, and infrastructure.

For three years and two months, I played a crucial role in Block A gas development as part of a project team.

As a Project Coordinator, my role was diverse and essential to the success of the Block A gas development project. I managed subprojects, i.e., gas pipelines and well-site facilities. Additionally, I managed transportation, traffic, and SIMOPS (Simultaneous Operations).

To excel in my role, I oversaw the day-to-day activities, ensuring that all necessary steps were taken to prepare the plant for safe and efficient operations.

Furthermore, I facilitated the coordination and communication among different project phases, including drilling, construction, commissioning, and operations. This involved working closely with interdisciplinary teams to ensure seamless integration and efficient transitions between project stages.

Senior Project Management Specialist, May 2019 — Aug 2021 PT. Medco E& P Indonesia (MEPI)

From May 2019 to August 2021, the role I held was Senior Project Management Specialist at PT. Medco E&P Indonesia (MEPI). PT. Medco E&P Indonesia is a subsidiary of Medco Energi Internasional, Tbk., and is responsible for operating various oil and gas blocks in Indonesia. During my tenure, I was involved in the development of an oil and gas production field and facilities to provide oil and gas for local and international markets.

For a period of three years and four months, our team was assigned the task of developing the Medco Project Excellence Process (MPEP), which is the company's project management framework. As part of the team, my responsibilities included evaluating and enhancing the existing framework, as well as developing new MPEP references such as policies, manuals, guidelines, procedures, and templates. Our objective was to align MPEP with international project management standards like PMBOK, PRINCE2, and ISO 21500. We also aimed to incorporate Agile methodologies into our project management processes as we prepared for ISO 9000 certification.

Throughout the project, I collaborated closely with cross-functional teams and conducted a comprehensive review of our existing project management framework. This enabled me to identify areas that required improvement, and I incorporated best practices from PMBOK, PRINCE2, and ISO 21500 into our MPEP references. I also led the development of new policies, manuals, guidelines, procedures, and templates, ensuring that they met the highest industry standards.

To enhance our flexibility and responsiveness to changing project requirements, I facilitated the adoption of Agile methodologies within our project management processes. Additionally, I played a pivotal role in documenting and standardizing our project management processes as we prepared for ISO 9000 certification, ensuring compliance with quality management standards.

Project Risk Consultant, April 2020 - July 2020 Pertamina EP Cepu (PEPC) through PT. Ikonsultan Inovatama (IKON)

From April 2020 to July 2020, I worked as a Project Risk Consultant for Pertamina EP Cepu (PEPC) through PT. Ikonsultan Inovatama (Ikon). PEPC is a subsidiary of Pertamina Hulu Energi and plays an active role in managing the Cepu Block. PT. Ikonsultan Inovatama (IKON) is a national consultant specializing in the financial industry, project management, and information technology.

As a member of the project team for the Jimbaran Tiang Biru (JTB) gas plant development in Cepu, I worked as a Project Risk Consultant for a duration of four months. My responsibilities included conducting project quantitative risk analysis, facilitating risk identification workshops, and performing schedule risk quantitative analysis. I collaborated with project teams and stakeholders to identify, assess, and quantify potential risks associated with the project's schedule. I applied quantitative risk analysis techniques to evaluate the probability and impact of these risks, allowing for data-driven decision-making in risk management.

To facilitate the risk identification process, I conducted workshops that included a wide range of perspectives and expertise. Additionally, I developed a risk management plan that outlined strategies and actions to mitigate or address identified risks effectively. I performed schedule risk quantitative analysis using analytical tools and methods to assess the impact of risks on the project schedule. Detailed reports were developed to provide insights and recommendations to the project team.

Commissioning Manager, Sep 2021 — Feb 2022 PT. Kapuas Prima Coal (KPC) through PT. Multi Solusi Sejahtera (MSS)

Between September 2021 and February 2022, I worked at PT. Kapuas Prima Coal (KPC) as a Commissioning Manager via PT. Multi Solusi Sejahtera (MSS). PT. Kapuas Prima Coal is a mining and trading company that was founded in 2005. The company operates in Indonesia, extracting iron ore and galena, while producing lead and zinc concentrates. PT. MSS, on the other hand, is a mining services company that focuses on developing and executing small to medium-sized projects in Indonesia and Australia.

From September 2021 to February 2022, I was a Commissioning Manager for a lead smelter facility owned by PT. KPC, organized by PT.MSS. My responsibilities included creating a commissioning strategy, leading the commissioning team, overseeing the commissioning and start-up phase, managing testing procedures, and collaborating with cross-functional teams.

To ensure successful commissioning, I developed a well-structured commissioning strategy and plan that prioritized safety and environmental management. I led the commissioning team and oversaw the testing, verification, and preparation of all systems and equipment for seamless operation. Technical issues were addressed promptly to prevent delays and complications during the handover to operations.

Collaboration with cross-functional teams allowed for effective coordination of commissioning activities, ensuring that the project timeline was met and the facility was ready for successful operation.

Sr. Project Engineer (Interface Coordinator), March 2022 — Feb 2023 PT. Medco Power Indonesia (MPI)

Between March 2022 and February 2023, I held the position of Senior Project Engineer (Interface Coordinator) at PT. Medco Power Indonesia (MPI). PT. Medco Power Indonesia is a subsidiary of PT Medco Energi International Tbk, which is the largest national energy company in Indonesia. The company was founded in 2004 and serves as an independent power producer and operation and maintenance service provider.

The LNG terminal and regasification project required a team to conduct its early phase, and I was a part of it for a year. My role was that of a Senior Project Engineer and Interface Coordinator, where I managed the interfaces between different disciplines of the project. My responsibilities included developing execution plans, providing support to other projects within the MPI group, and facilitating communication among project disciplines and external stakeholders. I ensured that information was managed and coordinated, concerns were addressed, and project elements were aligned effectively. Apart from this, I also assisted other projects within the MPI group in project assurance. My responsibilities included assessing project health, identifying risks, and devising strategies to mitigate them, which contributed to the overall project management and success within the organization.

Site Manager, Mar 2023 — Oct 2023 PT. Medco Sumbawa Gas (MSG)

Between March 2023 and October 2023, I held the position of Site Manager at PT. Medco Sumbawa Gas (MSG), which is a subsidiary of PT. Medco Power Indonesia. In 2023, PT. Amman Mineral Internasional took over ownership of PT. MSG. The primary objective of PT. MSG was to construct and manage an LNG terminal and regasification facility located in West Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia. The purpose of this facility was to provide fuel gas to PT. AMNT's power generation plant and PT. AMIN's smelter plant.

I worked as a Site Manager for eight months in a project team responsible for constructing and commissioning the LNG terminal and regasification facility. My role involved coordinating multidisciplinary teams, acting as the primary operational safety inspector, managing stakeholder interfaces, overseeing on-site construction activities, and leading cross-functional teams. I ensured effective communication and collaboration among team members and stakeholders to manage all aspects of the project, including safety, quality control, and logistics. As the primary operational safety inspector (PJO), I ensured strict adherence to safety protocols and managed safety concerns during construction, based on Indonesian regulations. I collaborated with EPC contractors and clients to ensure that project milestones and objectives were met, while overseeing on-site construction activities to ensure compliance with schedules, safety protocols, and quality standards. Leading cross-functional teams and fostering collaboration among contractors, engineers, and stakeholders played a critical role in achieving a cohesive and efficient project execution, emphasizing the significance of teamwork in complex projects.

Project Risk Consultant, Sep 2023 — Oct 2023 PT. Mineral Industri Indonesia (MIND ID), through PT. Ikonsultan Inovatama (IKON)

From September 2023 to October 2023, I worked as a Project Risk Consultant at PT. Mineral Industri Indonesia (MIND ID) under the employment of PT. Ikonsultan Inovatama (IKON). PT. Mineral Industry Indonesia (MIND ID) is a mining industry holding SOE in Indonesia that comprises PT ANTAM Tbk, PT Bukit Asam Tbk, PT Freeport Indonesia, PT INALUM, and PT Timah Tbk. PT. Ikonsultan Inovatama (IKON) is a national consultant that specializes in the financial industry, project management, and information technology.

During the two-month period of my involvement in the project team, we successfully developed a comprehensive risk management framework that was applicable to all company subsidiaries. As a Project Risk Consultant, I played a significant role in shaping the organization's risk management framework by providing expert guidance on project risk management implementation and drafting guidelines and procedures for effective risk management. I collaborated closely with project teams and key stakeholders to offer expert guidance on implementing strong risk management practices. My knowledge and expertise in risk management helped to ensure that the framework was tailored to meet the specific needs and challenges of MIND ID and its subsidiaries.

Moreover, I drafted comprehensive risk management guidelines and procedures, ensuring that they were clear, practical, and aligned with the industry's best practices. These guidelines were critical resources for the organization's risk management efforts, enabling them to proactively identify, assess, and mitigate risks.
